title: Senior Resilience Management Analyst
content:
Empower the Individual Through Crypto
Gemini is a crypto exchange and custodian that allows customers to buy, sell, store, and earn more than 30 cryptocurrencies like bitcoin, bitcoin cash, ether, litecoin, and Zcash. Gemini is a New York trust company that is subject to the capital reserve requirements, cybersecurity requirements, and banking compliance standards set forth by the New York State Department of Financial Services and the New York Banking Law. Gemini was founded in 2014 by twin brothers Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss to empower the individual through crypto.
Crypto is about giving you greater choice, independence, and opportunity. We are here to help you on your journey. We build crypto products that are simple, elegant, and secure. Whether you are an individual or an institution, we want to help you buy, sell, and store your bitcoin and cryptocurrency. Crypto is not just a technology, it's a movement.
At Gemini, our mission is to empower the individual and that includes giving our employees flexibility of choice — our Office Optional Policy allows employees to choose to work from one of our physical locations or from home.
The Department: Platform
Our Platform organization’s purpose is to enable Gemini to scale effectively and empower our engineering teams to focus on building innovative financial products and experiences for individuals around the world.
The Role: Senior Resilience Management Analyst
As a Senior Resilience Management Analyst you will be responsible for the implementation of our policies and procedures, and coordination of risk assessments and audits within the Technology department as a whole. Working as part of our broader Production Engineering Team, this position will be a key personnel in coordinating around BCM, Governance within incident and problem management, and auditory functions for the Gemini technology group which are in adherence to local, federal, and international regulations. An ideal candidate will have strong focuses in risk management, cross team collaboration, and providing overall technology governance and improvements to processes which lead to the stabilization of the overall ecosystem.  
This is a hands-on position, working across the technology department, and cross-functionally across Gemini in partnership with Product, Risk, Audit, and Customer Support. You will be actively involved in the expansion of our BCM program, incident triage (when needed), auditing process, and refining team processes. You will coordinate with teams from across the organization in multiple aspects including getting projects safely delivered quickly, becoming a beacon of clairvoyance for audits, and rallying team members when needed end-to-end. You possess a strong sense of ownership and a desire to improve on every iteration. The core values of Gemini are heavily ingrained into this role and will grow to be a shining exemplar of the primary principles prized by the organization.
Responsibilities:

Track, review, and report on the implementation of technology processes (eg., Incident, Problem and BCM )
Help technology teams design and optimize their processes, in line with Gemini’s policies
Help technology teams manage and report on their operational responsibilities through metrics and dashboards
Work with Audit and Risk departments to conduct audit and risk assessments of Technology

Qualifications:

Knowledge of typical technology support frameworks. Eg ITSM, ITIL
Knowledge of reporting or BI tooling. Eg. Looker
Knowledge of ITSM tooling and processes, eg. Jira, Rootly (incident-Problem Management tool), Service Catalog and CMDB. 
Experience writing technical documentation or designing knowledge bases
Experience with toolings, e.g. git, github, confluence and G-suite
Knowledge of Agile methodologies
Experience with internal and external technology audits
Experience with incident and problem management, BCM and overall operational resiliency
Comprehension of devops best practices

It Pays to Work Here
 
The compensation & benefits package for this role includes:

Competitive starting salary
A discretionary annual bonus
Long-term incentive in the form of a new hire equity grant
Comprehensive health plans
401K with company matching
Annual Learning & Development stipend
Paid Parental Leave
Flexible time off

Salary Range: The base salary range for this role is between $95,000 - $133,000 in New York City, the State of California and the State of Washington. This range is not inclusive of our discretionary bonus or equity package. When determining a candidate’s compensation, we consider a number of factors including skillset, experience, job scope, and current market data.
At Gemini, we strive to build diverse teams that reflect the people we want to empower through our products, and we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. Equal Opportunity is the Law, and Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. If you have a specific need that requires accommodation, please let a member of the People Team know.
